1983-12-23.snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission today approved on a 4-to-0 vote an accounting device to let companies dress up their financial condition and show higher earnings by wiping long- term debt off their balance sheets.   The device, called in-su...
1983-12-23.lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission today approved on a 4-to-0 vote an accounting device to let companies dress up their financial condition and show higher earnings by wiping long- term debt off their balance sheets. The device, called in-substance corporate defeasance, allows companies to buy Government securities to reduce their balance sheet debt by an equal amount. Analysts said the technique would appeal primarily to companies with cash to spare and a lot of low-interest debt on their books.

headline.main: DEBT REDUCTION METHOD IS APPROVED BY S.E.C.

1983-12-31.snippet: American Can Co., Greenwich, Conn., said it had signed a definitive agreement to acquire the Harmony Hut division of Schwartz Brothers Inc. for about $8 million. Harmony Hut is a retailer of prerecorded music, video software, audio equipment and r...
1983-12-31.lead_paragraph: American Can Co., Greenwich, Conn., said it had signed a definitive agreement to acquire the Harmony Hut division of Schwartz Brothers Inc. for about $8 million. Harmony Hut is a retailer of prerecorded music, video software, audio equipment and related products.
